intro: Cnidoscolus liesneri, commonly known as the Brazilian arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its roots are edible and have been traditionally used as a starch source. The plant is also noted for its ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
